alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 2:10PM MDT until July 16 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL GRAND COUNTY... At 210 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicates thunderstorms that produced heavy rain over the warned area have moved east. However, between 0.7 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Grand County This includes the following additional locations... Lower Willow Creek Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry gulches is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
